title: Rebels kill DR Congo governor as fighting intensifies - reports
description: Conflict in eastern DR Congo's has forced 400,000 people to flee their homes this year alone, the UN says.

description: Some parties in the coalition government are considering going to court to challenge the law.

title: New Nigerian jihadist group declared terrorists
description: The Lakurawa group has been accused of attacks on top government officials and kidnapping.

title: Shades, sparks and snow: Africa's top shots
description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the African continent and beyond.

description: In a video message Monica Geingos warns people not to be duped into investing in fake schemes.

title: Abductions spark fears of a return to Kenya's dark past
description: "I was scared he had come to beat me or finish me off," a government critic tells the BBC about his ordeal.

description: Bernadino Rafael denies claims he worked with criminal groups to kidnap and kill protesters.

description: The Lakurawa group has been accused of attacks on top government officials and kidnapping.

title: 'We dig graves for free, like our fathers did before us'
description: For more than 50 years, one family has dedicated itself to caring for the biggest cemetery in Kaduna.

title: 'A living hell': Sudanese women face rape and abuse in Libya
description: The BBC hears about horrific violence five women experienced in Libya after fleeing war-torn Sudan.

title: The Muslim group that doesn't fast or perform daily prayers
description: The Baye Fall don't fast or perform five daily prayers - they believe hard work is the way to heaven.

title: Medics under siege: 'We took this photo, fearing it would be our last'
description: The last functioning hospital in Sudan's Darfur region has come under constant bombardment.

title: Why police baby killers are still not on trial seven years on
description: Seven years after Samantha Pendo's death her parents are still waiting for the trial of officers to begin.

title: The would-be African nation in love with Donald Trump
description: Somaliland hopes Donald Trump will make history by recognising it as a nation, but Somalis fear the move.

title: Mozambique at a crossroads as new president sworn in
description: Daniel Chapo's legitimacy has been questioned following protests against his victory.

title: Coventry aims to challenge 'status quo' at IOC
description: Zimbabwe's  Kirsty Coventry is aiming to become the first female president of the International Olympic Committee.

title: Caf says deputy leader faces no action over payments
description: African football's governing body says Swiss prosecutors will not bring legal charges against its secretary general Veron Mosengo-Omba.

title: Man City sign Egypt forward Marmoush for £59m
description: Egypt forward Omar Marmoush, the second highest scorer in the Bundesliga this season, has agreed a contract until 2029.

title: Man City accused of encouraging Sierra Leone's Bah to break contract
description: Real Valladolid accuse Manchester City of encouraging one of their players to break his contract to force through a move to the Premier League club.

title: History-maker Ngamba eyes world title shot
description: Cindy Ngamba, who will make her professional debut in London on 7 March, hopes to land a world title shot within a year.

title: 'Every face deserves a smile' - Adeyemi
description: Borussia Dortmund's Karim Adeyemi talks to BBC Sport Africa about his foundation and why he feels impelled to give back to Nigeria.

title: 'I never thought I could play ice hockey in Kenya'
description: East Africa's only rink is the one place in Nairobi where temperatures fall below 9C.

title: Africa's capoeira kids
description: Capoeira, a sport mixing martial art and dance, is one of Brazil’s biggest cultural exports. Now a new generation of African children are rediscovering its appeal and African roots.

title: Kenya investigates space junk that fell on village
description: Experts are trying to figure out how a 500kg metal ring ended up crashing into Kenya.

title: Fire devastates one of Africa's largest clothes markets
description: Ghana's Kantamanto market has been devastated by fire with traders urging the government to help.
